_header: Saint Guthlac was I-bore here in England
Subjects: saints’ lives; Guthlac, saint, life of
_description: Life of St. Guthlac in the South English Legendary — couplets

Bod779.First Lines:
Seint gutlac was a goodman Ibore here in ingelondeof his lif ich
                    mot telle þat ic ondirstonde…
Bod779.Last Lines:
…& leue vs so to don here þe whyle we beþ
                    alyue& to þin oune eritage vs bring for þy woundus
                    fyue
Bod779.Editions:
Forstmann,  Dr. H. von. 
             Sammelheft. Untersuchungen zur Guthlac-Legende.
Bonner Beiträge
         12. Bonn: Hanstein, 1902: 23.
Bolton,  W. F.,
                        ed.  
             “The Middle English and Latin Poems of St. Guthlac.” 
         Diss. Princeton, 1952; DA 15/11: 2201: 210.

CamCCC145.First Lines:
Synt guthlak was ibore her in engelandeOf his lyf ich mot telle
                    þat ich vnderstonde…
CamCCC145.Last Lines:
…Bidde we god of heuene vor his suete loueþat he vs
                    ȝeue þe blisse þat is in heuene a boue
CamCCC145.Note:
Written by a different hand than that which wrote rest of South
                        English Legendary in this MS.
CamCCC145.Editions:
Birch,  Walter de Gray. 
             Memorials of St. Guthlac of Crowland.
         Wisbech: Leach and Son, 1881: xxix (lines 1-24), xxx (lines 105-24).
Forstmann,  Dr. H. von. 
             Sammelheft. Untersuchungen zur Guthlac-Legende.
Bonner Beiträge
         12. Bonn: Hanstein, 1902: 22 (lines 1-24 from Birch).
Bolton,  W. F.,
                        ed.  
             “The Middle English and Latin Poems of St. Guthlac.” 
         Diss. Princeton, 1952; DA 15/11: 2201: 221.

BLCottJulDIX.First Lines: SEint gutlac was ibore here in englondeof his lif ich mot telle þat ich vnþerstonde…
BLCottJulDIX.Last Lines: …& bureþe him faire ynou as riȝt was to dogod bring ous to þilke ioie þat his soule wente to
BLCottJulDIX.Note: “Capitulum Cii” added to left margin by later hand (f. 297v).
